DataElement.preferredName: Frozen Malignant Neoplasm Specimen Availability Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: an indicator to describe access or readiness of a sample of tumor tissue composed of atypical neoplastic cells collected for research and preserved in solid phase by lowering tissue temperature.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to access or readiness for use for a sample of tumor tissue composed of atypical neoplastic cells collected for research and preserved in a solid matter phase by lowering tissue temperature.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: No value exists.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Available; obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

Concepts.definition: The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
